summary:
Ammonia (NHâ‚ƒ) is a colorless gas with a strong smell. It's made of nitrogen and hydrogen and is found in nature and space. Most ammonia is made in factories and used for fertilizers, helping plants grow. It's also used to make other chemicals.

Ammonia is important for living things as it helps provide the nitrogen plants need. However, it can be dangerous, so it's handled carefully. Liquid ammonia can be used without cooling, but it's often transported in special tanks.
title: Ammonia
